intro: Vesalea occidentalis, commonly known as the Western vesal, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Vesalea occidentalis is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
